TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ProgressEventArgs extends System.Management.ManagementEventArgs

Docs.summary: Holds event data for the event.
Gets the current amount of work done by the operation. This is always less than or equal to <xref:System.Management.ProgressEventArgs.UpperBound%2A>.
Docs.value: Returns an <xref:System.Int32> value representing the current amount of work already completed by the operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value An integer representing the current amount of work already completed by the operation.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](../Topic/Using%20Libraries%20from%20Partially%20Trusted%20Code.md).

Docs.returns: Returns an <xref:System.Int32> value representing the current amount of work already completed by the operation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets optional additional information regarding the operation's progress.
Docs.value: Returns a <xref:System.String> value containing information regarding the operation's progress.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value A string containing additional information regarding the operation's progress.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](../Topic/Using%20Libraries%20from%20Partially%20Trusted%20Code.md).

Docs.returns: Returns a <xref:System.String> value containing information regarding the operation's progress.

Docs.summary: Gets the total amount of work required to be done by the operation.
Docs.value: Returns an <xref:System.Int32> value representing the total amount of work to be done by the operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value An integer representing the total amount of work for the operation.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](../Topic/Using%20Libraries%20from%20Partially%20Trusted%20Code.md).

Docs.returns: Returns an <xref:System.Int32> value representing the total amount of work to be done by the operation.
